question_text: Which of the following best represents the evolution in data transfer rates from DDR2 to DDR5 memory?
answer_options: Gradual decrease in latency with slower throughput
Progressively higher transfer rates with no backward compatibility
Reduced memory module sizes across all generations
correct_answer: Progressively higher transfer rates with no backward compatibility
explanation: DDR generations (DDR2 â†’ DDR5) have continually increased data transfer speeds but are not backward compatible with earlier generations due to architectural changes.
